captions.text: - DID YOU FEEL THE EARTHQUAKE?

- OH, OKAY, I'VE NEVER
BEEN IN AN EARTHQUAKE.

AND SO IT'S--
- OH, REALLY?

- NO, I'VE NEVER BEEN
IN AN EARTHQUAKE, NEVER.

AND SO IT'S 6:20
SOMETHING OR OTHER,

AND I'M SITTING IN THE HOTEL
HERE IN L.A.,
AND I'M PUMPING.

BECAUSE I HAVE
A 14-WEEK-OLD BABY--

I'M HERE FOR 48 HOURS.
I COULDN'T BRING HIM.

IT'S TOO FAR.
IT'S A 12-HOUR PLANE RIDE.
AND SO I'M PUMPING,

STARING AT MY BEAUTIFUL PICTURE
OF MY BEAUTIFUL BABY BOY,

CALLED THEM--
MY HUSBAND'S ON THE OTHER LINE,
AND THE ROOM STARTS TO SHAKE.
SO I SAID, "I'VE GOT TO GO.

UM, I'VE GOT TO GO.
I'LL CALL YOU BACK."

HUNG UP, RAN INTO THE DOORFRAME
WITH MY FRIEND WHO WAS WITH ME,

AND SHE'S LIKE,
"IT'S AN EARTHQUAKE.

IT'S OKAY.
DON'T WORRY."
[mimics pump operating]

"IT'S PASSING.
IT'S GONNA--SEE, IT'S PASSING.

IT'S GONNA PASS."
[mimics pump operating]

"SEE, IT'S PA--
IT'S ALMOST GONE.

IT'S BREATHE.
IT'S FINE."
[mimics pump operating]

I JUST CARRIED ON PUMPING
THROUGH THE WHOLE ENTIRE THING.
- WELL, OF COURSE.

- YOU KNOW, US GIRLS, WE DO IT,
DON'T WE?

WHEN YOU DO IT, YOU JUST--
YOU JUST--YOU JUST DO IT.
- YOU'RE HOOKED UP TO IT.
YOU HAVE NO CHOICE.
YOU HAVE NO CHOICE.
YOU JUST HAVE TO.

IT WAS QUITE SCARY, THOUGH,
ACTUALLY.
- WERE YOU SCARED?
THAT WAS A SHORT ONE, THOUGH.

IT KIND OF--BY THE TIME I
ACTUALLY GOT UNDER A DOORFRAME,

WHICH NOW I HEAR
YOU'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO
GET UNDER A DOORFRAME, BUT--

- OH, WE'RE NOT?
WHAT ARE WE SUPPOSED TO DO?

- YOU'RE SUPPOSED TO--
AS LONG AS THERE'S NO

BIG, HEAVY FURNITURE OVER YOU
OR GLASS, STAY IN BED.
DON'T GET OUT OF BED.

BUT--
- THAT'S WHAT PORTIA DID.

- PORTIA STAYED IN BED, AND I--
WITH ALL THE DOGS--
THEY WERE JUST LOOKING AT ME,

AND I'M UNDER THE DOORFRAME
BY MYSELF GOING--

AND BY THE TIME I WAS SAYING,
"COME HERE," IT STOPPED.
BUT IT DIDN'T LAST THAT LONG,

SO THAT WAS NOT A BAD ONE
FOR YOU TO EXPERIENCE.
THAT WAS A BABY ONE.

- OKAY.
- SO--'CAUSE THEY CAN GET BAD.
THEY CAN GET--
SO YOU WERE SCARED.

- DO THEY THINK THERE'S GONNA BE
ANOTHER ONE, THOUGH?

- OF COURSE
THERE'LL BE ANOTHER ONE.

[stammers]
YES.

I MEAN, THERE'S BOUND
TO BE ANOTHER ONE.
- IS IT COMING TODAY?

- NO.
- OKAY, GOOD.

- CUT TO--
- I DON'T WANT THAT.

- NO, NOBODY WANTS IT.
NOBODY WANTS IT.
SO A LOT HAS HAPPENED.

YOU TALKED ABOUT YOU
JUST HAD A BABY 14 WEEKS AGO.

- YES, I DID.
- CONGRATULATIONS ON THAT.

- THANK YOU.
[cheers and applause]

- AND YOU HAVEN'T BEEN HERE
IN, LIKE,

FOUR YEARS
OR SOMETHING LIKE THAT.

- A LOT'S HAPPENED.
- A LOT HAS HAPPENED.

- BRAND-NEW BABY.
- YES, I DO.
AND YOUR HUSBAND--

- BRAND-NEW HUSBAND.
- BRAND-NEW HUSBAND.

- ALL KINDS OF BRAND-NEW THINGS
IN YOUR LIFE.
- ALL KINDS OF BRAND-NEW THINGS.
AND THE BABY'S NAME IS...

- BEAR.
- BEAR.
- AND I THINK THAT'S ADORABLE.

NOW, IS IT A FAMILY NAME OR
WHERE DO YOU FIND THE NAME BEAR?
- NO, IT'S-- WELL, I--

WE WERE THINKING ABOUT NAMES
DURING THE PREGNANCY,
AND ACTUALLY I HAD NEVER--

WHEN I WAS PREGNANT WITH MIA,
WHEN I WAS PREGNANT WITH JOE,

I DIDN'T NAME THEM
BEFORE THEY CAME OUT.

'CAUSE I ALWAYS FELT
I JUST HAVE TO SEE THEM

AND SEE WHO
THEY'RE GOING TO BE.

BUT OF COURSE, THIS TIME AROUND,
THERE'S MIA AND JOE,

AND THE WHOLE PREGNANCY
IS ABOUT,

"WHAT ARE WE GONNA
CALL THE BABY?"

SO IT WAS REALLY LOVELY,
ACTUALLY.
THEY WERE VERY MUCH INCLUDED.

AND WE SETTLED ON BEAR
QUITE EARLY ON.

A FRIEND OF MINE WHEN I WAS
YOUNGER WAS NICKNAMED BEAR.

AND I JUST HAD ALWAYS
REALLY LOVED IT.
HE WAS VERY MUCH A BEAR.

HE WAS EVERYONE'S
SHOULDER TO CRY ON,
HE WAS A BIG BEAR HUG.

HE WAS JUST THIS GREAT FIGURE
IN MY LIFE.

AND SO I JUST
HAD ALWAYS REMEMBERED IT.

AND SO THAT WAS
WHERE IT CAME FROM.

AND THEN BEAR'S SECOND NAME
IS BLAZE

BECAUSE MY HUSBAND AND I
MET IN A HOUSE FIRE, BASICALLY.

[laughter]
WELL, WE DID.
AND, UH--
- I KNOW ABOUT THIS.

- YEAH,
AND THE HOUSE BURNED DOWN,
AND WE SURVIVED.

BUT WE WANTED SOMETHING
OF THE FIRE,

AND SO "BLAZE" WAS THE NAME
WE CAME UP WITH.

BEAR BLAZE.
- BEAR BLAZE.

- AND YOUR HUSBAND'S LAST NAME--
HE CHANGED HIS LAST NAME.
IT'S ROCKNROLL?
- CORRECT.

- OKAY, SO HIS--
WHAT'S HIS FIRST NAME?
- HIS FIRST NAME IS NED.
- NED--NED ROCKNROLL.

THAT DOES NOT GO TOGETHER,
I DON'T THINK.

- BUT I THINK THAT'S--
YOU KNOW, IF ANYONE--

YOU KNOW, PEOPLE WHO KNOW NED
KNOW THAT HE'S VERY MUCH

ABOUT IRONY AND LIVING LIFE
AND HAVING FUN,

AND SO HE CHANGED IT
TO "ROCKNROLL."

- SO NOW--
- HE DID DO IT BEFORE HE MET ME.

- WHY, WOULD YOU HAVE OBJECTED
TO THAT?
- NO.
- I HAVE TO SAY THAT, DON'T I?
[laughter]

SO BUT IS BEAR'S LAST NAME
WINSLET OR--
- IT'S WINSLET.

- IT'S NOT ROCKNROLL.
- NO, IT'S NOT.
- WHY NOT?
- WHY DO YOU THINK, ELLEN?
[laughter]

- SO YOU WOULDN'T HAVE
ENCOURAGED HIM

TO CHANGE IT TO ROCKNROLL
IS WHAT YOU'RE SAYING.

title: Kate Winslet on Her Sons' Names

comments.text:
I think Leo will forever love Kate, here she is moving on and he's been 
single all life long﻿
comments.author: Angie C

comments.text:
I love original names! I think Bear is adorable!! I named my sons Uriah, 
Titus and Troah. (pronounced Tro-wah). Every name was unusual at some point 
in time. And with all the new names people are giving their kids now days, 
by the time all the babies grow up, it wont be unusual at all. I love the 
fact that I don't know anyone who has the same names that my kids have. 
They get to define these names. :) Go Kate!﻿
